DOC.brief_title: Effect Speed-dependent Treadmill Training Patients With Subacute Stroke
DOC.detailed_description: Objectives : To compare effect speed-dependent treadmill training ( SDT ) gait balance performance patient sub-acute stroke . Design : Double-blinded randomized control trial . Subjects : Twenty-six patient sub-acute stroke randomly assign SDT ( n=13 ) control ( n=13 ) group . Methods : Subjects SDT group undergo short interval walk trial stepwise increase treadmill speed , follow principle sprint training . Control subject receive gait training treadmill steady speed ( SST ) . Gait speed , stride length , cadence , Berg 's balance score ( BBS ) record analysed 10 training session . Results : Results two-way repeated measure ANOVA show significant group x time interaction gait speed stride length ( p < 0.05 ) . Within subject group , improvement gait parameter BBS ( p < 0.001 ) training program . In addition , SDT group show significantly large percentage increase gait speed ( 72.8 % ) stride length ( 29.2 % ) control subject ( p < 0.02 ) . Conclusions : SDT patient sub-acute stroke result large gain gait speed stride length compare SST . The positive finding provide evidence clinical practice SDT enhance gait function stroke .
